onyomiExamples.meaning: large fan-shaped object held by an attendant and used to conceal the face of a noble, etc.

kunyomiExamples.meaning: shade, shadow, behind (something), other side, back, background, behind the scenes, behind someone's back, gloom (in someone's expression, nature, etc.), darkness
shadow or cloud (e.g. on someone's happiness), shade, gloom
to darken, to get dark, to be clouded, to be hidden (behind clouds)
to hold up over one's head, to hold aloft, to hold over something, to hold (one's hands) out (e.g. towards a fire), to cover something with something, to hold up to shade one's eyes, face, etc.
